intro: Cacalia alliariae, commonly known as the coastal cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal bluffs and dunes, where it is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Its flowers are usually pale blue to lavender in color, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Cacalia alliariae is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a rare species in many areas.
